title: International Baccalaureate
requirements: for students in grade 11-12 with at least a GPA of 3.0
program details: IB is a globally recognized program offering rigorous coursework that emphasizes international mindedness and critical thinking. Students can earn an IB diploma recognized by universities worldwide.

title: Magnet
program details: Magnet programs offer specialized courses focused on specific themes or subject areas such as STEM, arts, or technology, drawing students from various neighborhoods to create diverse learning environments.

title: Advanced Placement - CAPS
requirements: for students in grade 9-12 with at least a GPA of 3.0
program details: CAPS combines Advanced Placement coursework with career-focused learning, allowing students to earn college credits while exploring professional pathways.

title: Honors
requirements: for students in grade 9-12 with at least a GPA of 3.0
program details: Honors courses provide advanced academic content at an accelerated pace, preparing students for college-level work while remaining within the standard curriculum framework.

title: Advanced International Certificate of Education
requirements: for students in grade 11-12 with at least a GPA of 3.0
program details: AICE is a Cambridge-based international curriculum offering college-level courses with an emphasis on global perspectives and independent research skills.

title: Dual Enrollment
requirements: for students in grade 11-12 with at least a GPA of 3.0
program details: Dual enrollment allows students to take college courses while still in high school, earning both high school and college credits simultaneously.
